stanza.line: Music to hear why hear thou musicsadly
Sweets with sweets war not joy delights injoy
Why lov thou that which thou receiv notgladly
Or else receiv with pleasure thineannoy
If the true concord of well tunedsounds
By unions married do offend thine ear
They do but sweetly chide thee whoconfounds
In singleness the parts that thou shouldst bear
Mark how one string sweet husband toanother
Strikes each in each by mutual ordering
Resembling sire and child and happymother
Who all in one one pleasing note do sing
Whose speechless song being many seemingone
Sings this to thee Thou single wilt provenone
